definition: to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint

sentences.english: Check that your head is in line with your spine.
sentences.chinese: 搜检你的头和脊椎是否已成一向线不要弯曲。

sentences.english: Integration testing checks whether the various modules are working properly together.
sentences.chinese: 集成测试搜检各个模块是否可以很好的协同工作。

sentences.english: Are you constantly checking to see if you have a missed call?
sentences.chinese: 你是否老是搜检有没有未接来电？

sentences.english: He carefully examined their export licence.
sentences.chinese: 他细心搜检了他们的出口允许证实。

sentences.english: Check downhole technology, such as checking the cementing quality and casing rupture, etc.
sentences.chinese: 搜检，如搜检井下技术进步固井量址⒔套管连开等。

sentences.english: Check downhole technology, such as checking the cementing quality and casing rupture, etc.
sentences.chinese: 搜检，如搜检井下技术进步固井量址⒔套管连开等。

sentences.english: The doctor gave the patient a thorough check-up.
sentences.chinese: 大夫为病人做了周全搜检。

sentences.english: Did you check the power plug and press the play ton?
sentences.chinese: 你可否搜检了电源插头并按了播放键了呢？

definition: to take inventory of and confiscate a criminal's possessions/to search and confiscate (forbidden items)/to raid
to do a body search/to frisk
to rummage/to look through/to leaf through
to follow up a study/to investigate
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
